page.title: 08LANDSCAPE,Rural Headcorn.
page.content: This rural section of ENGLAND is mainly Agricultural.It is situated in the middle of the{WEALD of KENT,}to the East of the busy but attractive village of HEADCORN and is mostly contained within that Parish.Sheltered by a ridge to the North, the land appears flat when approached from that direction but it is undulating country side, with hedge-lined fields and winding lanes.{Trees}are plentiful; some being protected by{Conservation } orders to prevent the destruction of the remaining decendants of the great FOREST OF ANDREDA which once covered this area. The patchwork of fields is puncuated with numerous small{Ponds,} some hidden by groups of Willow or undergrowth,and{Public footpaths}cross the meadows connecting the farms. Old Farmhouses and Oasts complete the land scape,which is pleasing in all Seasons
